The redirector XML document is missing some required information.

WU_E_PT_SOAPCLIENT_* error codes map to the SOAPCLIENT_ERROR enum of the ATL Server Library.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_INITIALIZE_ERROR - initialization of the SOAP client failed possibly because of an MSXML installation failure.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_OUTOFMEMORY - SOAP client failed because it ran out of memory.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_GENERATE_ERROR - SOAP client failed to generate the request.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_CONNECT_ERROR - SOAP client failed to connect to the server.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_SEND_ERROR - SOAP client failed to send a message for reasons of WU_E_WINHTTP_* error codes.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_SERVER_ERROR - SOAP client failed because there was a server error.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_SOAPFAULT - SOAP client failed because there was a SOAP fault for reasons of WU_E_PT_SOAP_* error codes.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_PARSEFAULT_ERROR - SOAP client failed to parse a SOAP fault.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_READ_ERROR - SOAP client failed while reading the response from the server.
Same as SOAPCLIENT_PARSE_ERROR - SOAP client failed to parse the response from the server.
Same as SOAP_E_VERSION_MISMATCH - SOAP client found an unrecognizable namespace for the SOAP envelope.
Same as SOAP_E_MUST_UNDERSTAND - SOAP client was unable to understand a header.
Same as SOAP_E_CLIENT - SOAP client found the message was malformed; fix before resending.
Same as SOAP_E_SERVER - The SOAP message couldn't be processed due to a server error; resend later.
There was an unspecified Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) error.
The number of round trips to the server exceeded the maximum limit.
WUServer policy value is missing in the registry.
Initialization failed because the object was already initialized.
The computer name couldn't be determined.
The reply from the server indicates that the server was changed or the cookie was invalid; refresh the state of the internal cache and retry.
Same as HTTP status 400 - the server couldn't process the request due to invalid syntax.
Same as HTTP status 401 - the requested resource requires user authentication.
Same as HTTP status 403 - server understood the request but declined to fulfill it.
Same as HTTP status 404 - the server can't find the requested URI (Uniform Resource Identifier).
Same as HTTP status 405 - the HTTP method isn't allowed.
Same as HTTP status 407 - proxy authentication is required.
Same as HTTP status 408 - the server timed out waiting for the request.
Same as HTTP status 409 - the request wasn't completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.
Same as HTTP status 410 - requested resource is no longer available at the server.
Same as HTTP status 500 - an error internal to the server prevented fulfilling the request.
Same as HTTP status 500 - server doesn't support the functionality required to fulfill the request.
Same as HTTP status 502 - the server while acting as a gateway or a proxy received an invalid response from the upstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.
Same as HTTP status 503 - the service is temporarily overloaded.
Same as HTTP status 503 - the request was timed out waiting for a gateway.
Same as HTTP status 505 - the server doesn't support the HTTP protocol version used for the request.
Operation failed due to a changed file location; refresh internal state and resend.
Operation failed because Windows Update Agent doesn't support registration with a non-WSUS server.
The server returned an empty authentication information list.
Windows Update Agent was unable to create any valid authentication cookies.
A configuration property value was wrong.

The HTTP request couldn't be completed and the reason didn't correspond to any of the WU_E_PT_HTTP_* error codes.
Same as ERROR_WINHTTP_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED - the proxy server or target server name can't be resolved.

Operation failed for all the updates. Most common issue is that antivirus software is blocking access to certain folders (like SoftwareDistribution). CBS.log analysis needed to determine the file or folder being protected.

The error occurs because not enough disk space exists on your physical computer or VM to store Windows updates for installation.

Windows Update Agent was unable to install due to running out of space in the recovery partition. Manual steps are necessary to complete the installation of this update on devices which are experiencing this error.
External .cab file processing completed with some errors
A handler operation couldn't be completed because the update contains invalid metadata. Rename the software redistribution folder and try to download the updates again:
The requested operation failed. Restart the system to roll back changes made.
Ensure that there are no firewalls that filter downloads. Such filtering could lead to incorrect responses being received by the Windows Update client.
The operation timed out. Ensure the host has access to Microsoft download URLs.

BITS is unable to transfer the file successfully. Encountered if BITS is broken or if the file being transferred can't be written to the destination folder on the client. This error is caused by connection errors while checking or downloading updates.
The operation timed out. Ensure the host has access to Microsoft download URLs. This can also be potentially caused by issues with system components. Please run DISM and SFC on the host and reboot.
Indicates data that isn't valid was downloaded or corruption occurred. Attempt to redownload the update and start installation.
Indicates that the Windows Update Service is shutting down. This error can occur after a long period of time of inactivity. The system fails to respond
column4: leading to the service being idle and causing the service to shut down. Ensure that the system remains active and the connections remain established to complete the installation.

Description: The download failed because the local user was denied authorization to download the content. Ensure that the user attempting to download and install updates has been provided with sufficient privileges to install updates (Local Administrator).
The operation was canceled by the user or service. You might also receive this error when we're unable to filter the results.

A servicing operation is taking a long time to complete. The servicing stack watchdog timer expires. Extending the timeout will mitigate the issue. Increase the resources on the device. If a virtual machine
column4: increase virtual CPU and memory to speed up operations. Make sure the device has installed the update in KB4493473 or later.

Description: Typically this error is due component store corruption caused when a component is in a partially installed state. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
Subsequent error logged after getting 0x800f0821.
Component Store corruption. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
Component Store corruption. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
File system or registry key permissions have been changed and the servicing stack doesn't have the required level of access. Check CBS log at %Windir%\logs\CBS\CBS.log.
Component Store corruption. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
The servicing stack can't access a specific path. Check CBS log at %Windir%\logs\CBS\CBS.log.
Numerous causes. CBS log analysis required. Reported as caused by non-Microsoft filter drivers on the host.
Component Store corruption. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
Component Store corruption. Please run the following commands on the host and reboot before reattempting the patch: Dism.exe /Online /Cleanup-Image /Restorehealth. Sfc.exe /Scannow
TLS 1.2 isn't configured correctly on the client.
Unable to scan for updates due to a connectivity issue to Windows Update
Unable to authenticate through a proxy server. Either the Winhttp proxy or WinInet proxy settings aren't configured correctly. Please check proxy status with "netsh winhttp show proxy"
Unable to connect to the configured update source. Same as HTTP status 503 - the service is temporarily overloaded.

This error occurs during driver installation as part of the update. Please follow steps at the following url: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/windows-client/installing-updates-features-roles/common-windows-update-errors#0x80070490
The July cumulative update failed to be installed on Windows Server 2016. In the CBS.log
column4: you may find that updates sometimes roll back when License and Product key tokens fail to be updated. This issue can be resolved by adding write permissions for the "User" and "Network Service" accounts to the C:\Windows\System32\spp\ folder.

Description: The TrustedInstaller service startup type is set to "Manual" by Group Policy (GPO)
column4: which prevented it from starting to complete pending operations. Further troubleshooting steps can be found here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/windows-client/installing-updates-features-roles/common-windows-update-errors#0x80070bc9-1

Description: The last cumulative update failed to install and was corrupted. To resolve this issue navigate to the registry key for the corrupted update package. Change the "current state" value to 000020 hex (32 dec) - resolved or 000040 hex (64 dec) - staged or 000070 hex (112 dec) - installed.
